newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: MUSIC unit ups stake in U.S. subsidiary.
newsitem.headline: MUSIC unit ups stake in U.S. subsidiary.

text.p: Computer network manufacturer MUSIC Semiconductors Corp said on Friday its subsidiary Music NV had taken another 49.99 percent of U.S. company NewVoice at no additional cost.
Music NV, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Music based in The Netherlands, bought 50 percent and one share of NewVoice at $7 per share last August.
The deal also gave Music an option, but not an obligation, to buy another 49.99 percent of NewVoice at $9 apiece.
The US-based NewVoice designs and markets circuit boards for the voice processing segment of the international telecommunications market.

"The acquisition of the remaining 49.99 percent of the issued and outstanding capital stock of NewVoice by MUSIC N.V. came at no additional cost to MUSIC N.V.," assistant corporate secretary Maria Theresa Cortes told the Securities and Exchange.
She said MUSIC N.V. was able to renegotiate the terms after a due diligence on NewVoice which did not meet the desired performance targets it said it would during the earlier deal.
